Our organic manufacturing processes are subject to the United States Department of Labor Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Process Safety Management Standard (29 CFR 1910.119).  The Process Safety Management Standard, which is commonly referred to as PSM, requires subject facilities to perform specific accident prevention activities.  USEPA's Risk Management Plan (RMP) also requires applicable facilities to develop an accident prevention program; RMP essentially adopted all of PSM accident prevention program requirements as RMP program requirements.  The accident prevention program requirements that Nouryon has implemented include:



     *   Conduct comprehensive process hazard analyses to identify potential causes of accidents

     *   Develop and maintain detailed operating procedures for all processes

     *   Provide comprehensive employee training on subject processes

     *   Periodically verify, through non-destructive testing, the integrity of key process components

     *   Develop Management of Change written procedure for reviewing proposed process changes

     *   Conduct pre-startup reviews whenever any qualifying modification is made to the subject process

     *   Conduct PSM and RMP compliance audits every 3 years

     *   Conduct incident investigations whenever an incident could have resulted in a catastrophic release

     *   Employee participation in conducting process hazards analyses

     *   Ensuring contractors are fully trained and periodic review of their performances



Several different

management systems have been implemented to assist with reducing chemical incidents, minimizing employee exposures, increasing plant safety, protecting the environment, and maintaining appropriate security practices.  Nouryon Functional Chemicals LLC has received accreditation from the International Standards Organization (ISO) for a Health, Safety, Environment, and Security Management System (RC 14001), a Quality Management System (ISO 9001), and an Environmental Management System (ISO 14001).  These three management systems allow for safety and environmental reviews to be performed before any requested process change can be made at our facility.



Nouryon Functional Chemicals LLC has been an active participant in OSHA's Voluntary Protection Program (VPP)  voluntary site safety inspections by OSHA that Nouryon Functional Chemicals LLC has undertaken to ensure our facility's existing safety program meets or exceeds all of OSHA's requirements.  Our facility has achieved and continues to maintain the highest accreditation possible since 1999 STAR status.  Volunteering for OSHA's VPP program is yet another example of how the site has made a commitment in ensuring the highest degree of chemical, employee, and plant safety.   



OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS SUMMARY



The offsite consequences associated with both the worst case and alternate release scenarios have been removed from the Executive Summary pursuant to April 9, 2004 Federal Register.





FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There are no incidents that meet the criteria for the RMP five year accident history. 



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Nouryon Functional Chemicals LLC is subject to various Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and United States Environmental Protection Agency (USEPA) emergency response program regulations.  A detailed written emergency response plan has been developed and addresses how we would promptly and efficiently respond to onsite emergencies.



All onsite Emergency R

esponse Team members are trained in accordance with federal emergency response training requirements given at 29 CFR 1910.120; quarterly and annual emergency response training is conducted to maintain the overall readiness of the emergency response personnel and equipment.  The site conducts frequent real-time emergency drills with exercises involving simulated hazardous material releases.  Nouryon is a member of the Channel Industries Mutual Aid (CIMA) Association, and participates in an annual drill involving member CIMA companies.  Our site also undergoes periodic site inspections by CIMA to ensure our overall level of emergency response readiness.



Should an emergency event ever occur onsite, the public would be informed of the event by a representative of Nouryon Polymer Chemicals by placing a recorded message on the local Community Awareness Emergency Response line (online system). The person with overall responsibility for coordinating our response to an onsite emergency (Incident Commander) has the responsibility of ensuring that all agency and community notifications are promptly made.



PLANNED SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS



The site has completed its triannual PSM Compliance Audit and five-year PHA Reviews of the affected Percarbonate, and MPP Plants.  Action plans have been developed and are tracked monthly.
